title: Chi Rho
summary: The Chi Rho (/ˈkaɪ ˈroʊ/; also known as chrismon[1]) is one of the earliest forms of christogram, formed by superimposing the first two (capital) letters—chi and rho (ΧΡ)—of the Greek word ΧΡΙΣΤΟΣ  (Christos)  in such a way that the vertical stroke of the rho intersects the center of the chi.[2]
